It is absolutely incorrect to state that Fascists are corporatists. They are the opposite. Corporatists seek the control of government by corporation, Fascists seek the control of the economy, industry and corporations by GOVERNMENT.

Undo two revisions. One changes the wording so as to be contrary to the source cited. The other adds a "further reading item" of doubtful value.
Incorrect description of fascism: fascism is not a political ideology or form of government; the term describes a style of mass movement, usually related to the ascendency of autocratic regimes.
Clarified that Fascism is only informed by a particular strand of Corporatism, so as not to confuse readers that Corporatism itself is necessarily a fascist ideology.
/* Used within and against Communism */ Sarah Palin, Glenn Beck, and Rush are just commentators and are not philosophers, academics, or notable statesmen with knowledge of what fascism is
